name: Zaahen

sources.import_notes: Generated baseline canonical champion file from From Online dataset.

notes: Ability effects are intentionally minimal placeholders until scripted modeling is added.

passive.name: Cultivation of War
passive.description: Innate:  Zaahen's  basic attacks and  abilities against enemy  champions grant him  stacks of Determination, refreshing on subsequent damage to champions and stacking up to 12 times.
passive.description_source:
The bonus attack damage granted by Determination stacks will update dynamically with Zaahen's total attack damage.
Determination stacks are generated per damage instance per champion damaged with Zaahen's attacks and abilities.
 The Darkin Glaive's initial cast empowered attack can generate a stack for each strike.
Both passes of  Dreaded Return can generate a stack.
Both  Aureate Rush's swing and  Grim Deliverance's shockwave generate a stack for every champion hit.
During the resurrection's health restoration, Zaahen's  current health is set to a percentage of his maximum health equal to the cumulative amount of health restored on that restoration tick, for every single tick.
In other words, his current health will always be overridden by the percentage of health he is supposed to have restored on every restoration tick, to prevent him from healing or restoring health by other sources.
Upon the resurrection being triggered, all summoner spells that are not already on cooldown are placed on a 5-second  cooldown.
The  untargetability from the resurrection does not  destroy in-flight  projectiles.
Cultivation of War's resurrection takes priority over  Guardian Angel's Rebirth, but grants priority to  Zilean's  Chronoshift.
The resurrection does not activate if Zaahen is killed by the  Nexus Obelisk.
 Spell shield will not prevent stacks from being generated, even if no damage is dealt.(bug)
Cultivation of War  stacks additively with  Infernal Might and  Overlord's Bloodmail's Retribution.
Determination stacks are displayed in a secondary resource bar under Zaahen's health bar.
The bar is white at <4 stacks, yellow at ≥4 stacks and orange at ≥9 stacks.
At maximum stacks, if the revive is available, the bar will be red and will remain red after Zaahen revives until he loses stacks again.(note)
There's a short delay between the stacks falling off and the removal of the revive. If Zaahen triggers it during this time, it will fail to go on cooldown.(bug)
The following table refers for interactions while Zaahen is locked out during the resurrection:

basic_ability_1.name: The Darkin Glaive
basic_ability_1.description: Active:  Zaahen's next  basic attack strikes twice, dealing modified physical damage, applying  on-hit effects and  healing him based on his maximum health.
basic_ability_1.description_source:
Spell shield will only block the knock up from the recast.
Since the healing is granted on-attack, parrying effects will not prevent Zaahen from gaining the heal. Otherwise, parrying effects will negate all other aspects of The Darkin Glaive's attacks while consuming them.
The ability will not heal against wards, plants, or structures.
The first cast's double-strike attack:
Rolls  critical strike once for both strikes.
Does not cause Zaahen to attack twice.
Effects that trigger on-attack or interact with the attack windup will only trigger once and thus do not interact with The Darkin Glaive. (e.g.  Lethal Tempo,  Hail of Blades).
Will consume  Bone Plating once.(bug)
If the first strike triggers the rune, the second one will get blocked by it.
If the first strike is blocked by the rune, the second one will not.
The 1.5-second delay is not "fuzzy" (it will never take up to another 0.25 seconds) and so will never correctly sync up with  Sheen like  Camille's  Precision Protocol.(note)

basic_ability_2.name: Dreaded Return
basic_ability_2.description: Active:  Zaahen extends his glaive in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies hit. Upon reaching maximum range, all enemies in the area are dealt physical damage,  stunned briefly, and  pulled toward Zaahen.
basic_ability_2.description_source:
Spell shield will block both passes, as well as the second one individually if circumstances permit.
 Intercepting the initial projectile will instantly trigger Dreaded Return's pull.
 Displacement immunity will not resist the application of the  stun.
The projectile is shown on the minimap and Dreaded Return can be cast targeting the minimap.
This ability will cast from wherever the caster is at the end of the cast time.
Dreaded Return's end point will not move in relation to Zaahen if he moves during the cast time.
Dreaded Return briefly provides  vision over an area.
PENDING FOR TEST: How big is the vision bubble and how long does it last?

basic_ability_3.name: Aureate Rush
basic_ability_3.description: Active:  Zaahen  dashes to the target location. Upon arrival, he flourishes his glaive to deal physical damage to nearby enemies.
basic_ability_3.description_source:
The dash does not have a minimum cast distance.
If the dash is interrupted, Zaahen will fail to deal damage.
Zaahen will, however, deal damage if the dash is interrupted at the very end, shortly before the damage would occur.(bug)[2]
The mixed damage is applied in two instances, and the physical damage will be dealt first within the same game tick.
If the physical damage finishes off the unit, the magic damage will not be dealt against it.(bug)

ultimate.name: Grim Deliverance
ultimate.description_source:
The lockout, damage reduction, and displacement immunity may last for up to an additional 0.25 seconds after the slam due to fuzziness.(note)
The healing per champion is equal to 33% of the damage numbers, not the damage dealt.(note)
 Spell shield will block the damage but not the heal.(note)
If Zaahen  blinks or has his dash otherwise interrupted while ascending into the air, Grim Deliverance's effects are canceled; he will not slam the ground and will not update his animations correctly, additionally, he will be able to move during the lockout.(bug)
If Zaahen moves during the 0.6-second delay, he will slam down at his new location despite the indicator not moving.(bug)
Zaahen will transition from having  total crowd control immunity during the cast time, to having  displacement immunity during the dash and the slam delay.
